Aeon Wyrd.name: Aeon Wyrd
Aeon Wyrd.description:
Required Number of Abilities 3 

Granted Abilities @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.ZHSzNt3NxkXbj1mI]{Flier}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.Item.5eqcXtPsYunphMOZ]{Construct}

An aeon wyrd is a floating swarm of gemstones surrounding a larger stone. It grants the power of its internal aeon stone to its master.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-abilities.werYyT5BSeZbc9cH]{Aeon Stone Reservoir}

@Embed[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-abilities.werYyT5BSeZbc9cH inline]

Can't Walk

Your aeon wyrd has no land Speed.

Crystalline

Your aeon wyrd's crystalline structure makes it vulnerable to sonic attacks. It gains weakness to sonic damage equal to your level.

Alchemical Familiar.name: Alchemical Familiar
Alchemical Familiar.description:
You have used alchemy to create life, a simple creature formed from alchemical materials, reagents, and a bit of your own blood. You gain a familiar, which has the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.Item.5eqcXtPsYunphMOZ]{construct} familiar ability (Player Core 212); this is permanent, doesn't require the familiar to have the tough familiar ability, and doesn't count against your usual limit of familiar abilities (typically 2).

The familiar uses your Intelligence modifier to determine its Perception, Acrobatics, and Stealth modifiers.

Calligraphy Wyrm.name: Calligraphy Wyrm
Calligraphy Wyrm.description:
Access affiliation with Cobyslarni or the Pathfinder Society

Required Number of Abilities 6

Granted Abilities @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.0Xrkk46IM43iI1Fv]{Darkvision}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.ZHSzNt3NxkXbj1mI]{Flier}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.cT5octWchU4gjrhP]{Manual Dexterity}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.FlRUb8U13Crj3NaA]{Scent}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.jevzf9JbJJibpqaI]{Skilled} (arcana, society), @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.zyMRLQnFCQVpltiR]{Speech}

Calligraphy wyrms are curious dragons constantly in search of new lore and writing. They make natural allies for academics of all stripes, whether remaining in the towers of Cobyslarni or heading into fieldwork like the Pathfinder Society, but also found working with witches contracted to draconic powers or wizards who've somehow managed to impress the tiny creatures.
While knowledgeable, calligraphy wyrms can also be know-it-alls. Their chirpy, high-pitched voices make this attitude humorous to some and insufferable to others.

1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-actions.uQogznOvnZpPJtmE]{Ink Spray}

@Embed[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-actions.uQogznOvnZpPJtmE inline]

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-abilities.51cKcs7BCoTQhhVM]{Stylus Claws}

@Embed[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-abilities.51cKcs7BCoTQhhVM inline]

Ceru.name: Ceru
Ceru.description:
Required Number of Abilities 4

Granted Abilities @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.rs4Awf4k1e0Mj797]{Cantrip Connection} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.izcxFQFwf3woCnFs]{Guidance}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.pwzdSlJgYqN7bs2w]{Telekinetic Hand}), @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.0Xrkk46IM43iI1Fv]{Darkvision}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.XCqYnlVbLGqEGPeX]{Touch Telepathy}

Cerus are mortal-made creatures in the shape of tiny, blue elephants with spikes on their feet, tail, and ears. They're highly sought-after amongst circles of the affluent.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-abilities.gFkIZNIvFPmqWN2N]{Created Magic}

@Embed[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-abilities.gFkIZNIvFPmqWN2N inline]

2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-actions.eRIIwcyU4lbFETzX]{Turn of Fate}

@Embed[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-actions.eRIIwcyU4lbFETzX inline]

Clockwork Familiar.name: Clockwork Familiar
Clockwork Familiar.description:
Required Number of Abilities 3

Granted Abilities @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.0Xrkk46IM43iI1Fv]{Darkvision}

A clockwork creature is typically composed entirely of turning gears and small bronze steam pipes. It can take the form of any Tiny animal, such as a small mammal, reptile, or bird. Its eyes are cut from glittering glass, with many facets within to help it process what it sees. Any teeth, beak, and tongue are rendered out of iron. When it moves, its joints emit little croaks and whistles, and it occasionally emits electrical sparks if perturbed.
Clockwork creatures who live near the sea, or are otherwise exposed to water often, might squeeze lemons and use the juice to wash themselves. They can also blow steam out of the pipes on their bodies to intimidate an enemy or put up a smokescreen.
Your clockwork familiar is a specific familiar. Specific familiars are familiars with unique abilities. In order for you to choose a specific familiar, your familiar must be capable of having the template’s required number of familiar abilities. A specific familiar gains the listed traits and several abilities, including abilities it can gain only as a specific familiar. Much like a familiar that naturally has a familiar ability, you can never swap out any of these granted or unique abilities. Once you’ve selected a specific familiar, you can’t change it without losing your familiar—this uses the same rules as if your familiar had died. If your familiar gains more abilities than necessary to become a specific familiar, you can spend the remaining abilities normally. If your clockwork familiar is destroyed, it can be brought back to life through any conventional means that would bring back a living familiar, such as through resurrection magic.

Clockwork

You need to keep your clockwork familiar wound, but the process isn't particularly onerous or time consuming. If you spend 1 minute winding up your clockwork familiar with a unique key only you can use, it can remain active for 24 hours, after which time it becomes unaware of its surroundings and can't act until it's wound again.

Enemies can attempt to disable the clockwork familiar, with a standard DC for your level to Disable a Device, to reduce the remaining operational time by 1 hour (or 2 hours on a critical success). Certain other abilities that adversely affect technology might also reduce the clockwork familiar's remaining operational time.

Some abilities, like Steam Screen, require your clockwork familiar to spend some of its remaining operational time. It can't spend more than it has and shuts down immediately once it has no time remaining.

You can wind your clockwork familiar for 1 minute at any time to return it to the maximum 24 hours of operational time.

Constructed

Your clockwork familiar is made of metal rather than flesh and bone, although it is still delicate enough in certain places to be vulnerable to violence in the same manner as a living creature. It is immune to bleed, death effects, disease, doomed, drained, fatigued, healing, necromancy, nonlethal attacks, paralyzed, poison, sickened, and unconscious. It can recover Hit Points only via the Repair action and other methods that fix items, not from any form of Hit Point healing. It's destroyed at 0 Hit Points.

Electricity Vulnerability

The metal components of a clockwork familiar conduct electricity and are easily disrupted by an electric current. It gains weakness to electricity damage equal to your level.

1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-actions.2xmFosTcvpPxSA7M]{Steam Screen}

@Embed[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-actions.2xmFosTcvpPxSA7M inline]

2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-actions.vVALSSyBQg0bJw8K]{Toggle Standby Mode}

@Embed[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-actions.vVALSSyBQg0bJw8K inline]

Corgi Mount.name: Corgi Mount
Corgi Mount.description:
The smallest of fey have ridden corgis as mounts since time immemorial, leading to a pattern on corgis' backs called a “faerie saddle.” You have formed a magical connection with a corgi that can serve as your mount.
Your corgi familiar is Small rather than Tiny, and it's appropriate for use as your mount, unlike most familiars.
It has the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.FlRUb8U13Crj3NaA]{Scent} ability, which counts against your limit for familiar and master abilities as normal.
Furthermore, it can never gain a familiar ability that grants it any Speeds other than a land Speed.
If you're a pixie, you can't ride a corgi due to your Size, but you can take this feat to gain a corgi familiar.

Crawling Hand.name: Crawling Hand
Crawling Hand.description:
Required Number of Abilities 5

Granted Abilities @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.cT5octWchU4gjrhP]{Manual Dexterity}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.wOgvBymJOVQDSm1Q]{Spell Delivery}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.9PsptrEoCC4QdM23]{Valet}

Crawling hands make grisly but striking familiars, popular among necromancers with an eye for aesthetics. They also tend to be convenient, due to many available spare parts. Crawling hands can be skeletal or fleshy, like a zombie.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-abilities.YVylhAbBeo4r1Nr8]{Lend a Hand}

@Embed[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-abilities.YVylhAbBeo4r1Nr8 inline]

Undead

Your familiar is undead. It has negative healing and is immune to death effects, disease, poison, and unconscious. It's destroyed at 0 HP.

Cullitox Shardlings.name: Cullitox Shardlings
Cullitox Shardlings.description:
Required Number of Abilities 3

Granted Abilities @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.uy15sDBuYNK48N3v]{Burrower}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.ch6nFcRJO1fm8B4D]{Elemental} (earth only), @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.zyMRLQnFCQVpltiR]{Speech}

A cullitox shardling is a younger, smaller version of cullitox. When acting as a familiar, a shardling's hunger for crystals is sated by magic, turning an urgent need into a mere interest.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-abilities.DLDjnhO8c7KN9DXQ]{Crystal Scent}

@Embed[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-abilities.DLDjnhO8c7KN9DXQ inline]

Dust Bunny.name: Dust Bunny
Dust Bunny.description:
Required Number of Abilities 4

Granted Abilities @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.Item.5eqcXtPsYunphMOZ]{Construct}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.Item.2fiQzoEKu6YUnrU9]{Independent}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.Item.pX73zPGaazVJ0lKO]{Play Dead}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.Item.jevzf9JbJJibpqaI]{Skilled (Arcana)}

If you, despite the warning, desire a dust bunny companion, or perhaps you have one by accident and are willing to care for it, this section is for you. Dust bunnies greatly enjoy company and will often desire to lie on your lap or desk. Wherever they keep you company, ensure the area is regularly cleaned of any new or shed debris; otherwise, another dust bunny may form.

To feed your dust bunny, simply keep the collections from your daily housekeeping. However, if you notice they begin growing to an unreasonable size, be sure to limit their portions, as they have been known to grow to the size of large dogs.

It's important to remember that having formed of their own accord, dust bunnies are highly independent. While this makes them great companions and assistants, this also makes dust bunnies prone to making mischief, often spreading dirt out of spite or simply by wasting away. One should be vigilant for such things, for more dust and debris creates the perfect environment for new dust bunnies to form, and one can quickly be overrun with an infestation of dust bunnies!

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-actions.Item.cKc4g0KFipQW05Nz]{Kick Up Dust}

@Embed[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-actions.Item.cKc4g0KFipQW05Nz inline]

Dweomercat Cub.name: Dweomercat Cub
Dweomercat Cub.description:
Required Number of Abilities 4

Granted Abilities @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.0Xrkk46IM43iI1Fv]{Darkvision}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.FlRUb8U13Crj3NaA]{Scent}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.zyMRLQnFCQVpltiR]{Speech}

Pathfinder agent Arianrhod Thriceborn, an adherent of the Eldest Magdh, raised a litter of these intelligent mystical felines from the First World. Dweomercat cubs are curious and love exploring ley lines and traveling the world. At only 1 foot tall and weighing 15 pounds, dweomercat cubs are smaller than their egos and curiosity imply.

1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-actions.h3IYvi65ACEIl8Tl]{Alter Dweomer}

@Embed[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-actions.h3IYvi65ACEIl8Tl inline]

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-abilities.ODEDNHdrKVObNjyq]{Detect Magic}

@Embed[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-abilities.ODEDNHdrKVObNjyq inline]

Elemental Familiar.name: Elemental Familiar
Elemental Familiar.description:
Prerequisites Elementalist Dedication, Familiar

Your familiar becomes an elemental spirit capable of taking on aspects of the elements. Other than taking the form of an elemental instead of an animal, this familiar continues to use all the same rules as other familiars.

Your familiar gains one additional familiar ability each day, which must be one of the following elemental familiar abilities. While your familiar has an elemental familiar ability, your familiar is composed of the associated elemental matter and gains the matching elemental trait. You can't select more than one elemental familiar ability at a time.

  • Air If your familiar stays completely still for 1 round, it becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible} until it next takes an action. Any motion, even being moved or carried by another creature, ends this effect.
  • Earth Your familiar gains resistance to physical damage (except adamantine) equal to half your level.
  • Fire Your familiar sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius (and dim light for the next 20 feet) and emits warmth. Creatures that remain within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:15] don't take damage from severe environmental cold.
  • Metal Your familiar gains resistance to physical damage from metal weapons equal to half your level.
  • Water Your familiar can move through a gap at least 2 inches wide without @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.kMcV8e5EZUxa6evt]{Squeezing} and can Squeeze through a gap at least 1 inch wide.
  • Wood If your familiar remains in bright light for 1 round, it gains fast healing equal to half your level. Once it is out of bright light, this effect ends.

Elemental Scamp.name: Elemental Scamp
Elemental Scamp.description:
Required Number of Abilities 5

Granted Abilities @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.ch6nFcRJO1fm8B4D]{Elemental}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.ZHSzNt3NxkXbj1mI]{Flier}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.zyMRLQnFCQVpltiR]{Speech}

The elementals called scamps look similar to bats, but their bodies are made primarily of elemental matter. They have large, staring eyes and small, curved fangs. An elemental scamp familiar is a bit smaller than other scamps but makes up for it by being more mischievous. Driven by ego, scamps often take on long names with many titles and insist on being addressed in full.

2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-actions.Item.M8Uz2EldibONPIht]{Elemental Breath}

@Embed[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-actions.Item.M8Uz2EldibONPIht inline]

Scamp Elements

An elemental scamp's element or elements are set. You choose a type of scamp and can't change the element each day. This determines the scamp's elemental traits and the damage type of their Elemental Breath. Air (air) slashing damage; earth (earth) bludgeoning damage; fire (fire) fire damage; metal (metal) slashing damage; water (water) acid damage; wood (plant, wood) poison damage.

Elemental Mobility

Your scamp gains a familiar ability depending on its element. Air scamps gain @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.ZHSzNt3NxkXbj1mI]{Flier}, earth scamps gain @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.uy15sDBuYNK48N3v]{Burrower}, fire scamps gain @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.fhyQ6uTSvfErTzyE]{Jet}, metal scamps gain @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.q9IXWngAOCpsXxsO]{Levitator}, water scamps gain @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.A0C86V3MUECpX5jd]{Amphibious}, and wood scamps gain @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.dWTfO5WbLkD5mw2H]{Climber}.

Elemental Wisp (Grand Bazaar).name: Elemental Wisp (Grand Bazaar)
Elemental Wisp (Grand Bazaar).description:
Required Number of Abilities 3

Granted Abilities @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.92lgSEPFIDLvKOCF]{Accompanist}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.zyMRLQnFCQVpltiR]{Speech}

Wisps are tiny elemental beings that often act as familiars to spellcasters attuned to the elements. They each usually have different personalities: air wisps are playful and capricious, earth wisps are timid but loyal, fire wisps are carefree and boisterous, and water wisps are gentle and nurturing.

Elemental

Choose air, earth, fire, or water. Your wisp is a wisp of that element and gains that trait. Your wisp gains a familiar ability depending on its element. Air wisps gain @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.ZHSzNt3NxkXbj1mI]{Flight}, earth wisps gain @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.uy15sDBuYNK48N3v]{Burrower}, fire wisps gain @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.zKTL9y9et0oTHEYS]{Greater Resistance} (fire), and water wisps gain @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.A0C86V3MUECpX5jd]{Amphibious}.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-abilities.g9DW4uKh4HbjF2BE]{Resonance}

@Embed[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-abilities.g9DW4uKh4HbjF2BE inline]

Elemental Wisp (Rage of Elements).name: Elemental Wisp (Rage of Elements)
Elemental Wisp (Rage of Elements).description:
Required Number of Abilities 3

Granted Abilities @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.92lgSEPFIDLvKOCF]{Accompanist}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.ch6nFcRJO1fm8B4D]{Elemental}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.zyMRLQnFCQVpltiR]{Speech}

Wisps are tiny elementals that often act as familiars. They each usually have different personalities: air wisps are playful and capricious, earth wisps are timid but loyal, fire wisps are carefree and boisterous, metal wisps are serious and morose, water wisps are gentle and nurturing, and wood wisps are fierce and controlling.

Elemental Mobility

Your wisp gains a familiar ability depending on its element. Air wisps gain @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.ZHSzNt3NxkXbj1mI]{Flier}, earth wisps gain @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.uy15sDBuYNK48N3v]{Burrower}, fire wisps gain @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.fhyQ6uTSvfErTzyE]{Jet}, metal wisps gain @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.q9IXWngAOCpsXxsO]{Levitator}, water wisps gain @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.A0C86V3MUECpX5jd]{Amphibious}, and wood wisps gain @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.dWTfO5WbLkD5mw2H]{Climber}.

Innate Element

An elemental wisp's element is set. You choose the element when you gain the specific familiar and can't change it each day.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-abilities.Item.co7ukp3X71Nk220E]{Resonance}

@Embed[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-abilities.Item.co7ukp3X71Nk220E inline]

Fey Dragonet.name: Fey Dragonet
Fey Dragonet.description:
Required Number of Abilities 5 

Granted Abilities @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.0Xrkk46IM43iI1Fv]{Darkvision}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.ZHSzNt3NxkXbj1mI]{Flier}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.cT5octWchU4gjrhP]{Manual Dexterity}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.zyMRLQnFCQVpltiR]{Speech}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.XCqYnlVbLGqEGPeX]{Touch Telepathy}

These tiny, mischievous dragons make natural allies for benevolent or capricious characters.

2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-actions.Item.3xLVL24s9SCEMh2i]{Euphoric Breath}

@Embed[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-actions.Item.3xLVL24s9SCEMh2i inline]

Gennayn.name: Gennayn
Gennayn.description:
Required Number of Abilities 5

Granted Abilities @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.ch6nFcRJO1fm8B4D]{Elemental}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.zyMRLQnFCQVpltiR]{Speech}

Minor genies, gennayn are elementally adaptable and personable. They look like miniature humanoids with elemental energy surrounding them, and frequently carry messages or announce the arrival of their allies.

Elemental Mobility

Your gennayn gains a familiar ability depending on its element. Air gennayns gain @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.ZHSzNt3NxkXbj1mI]{Flier}, earth gennayns gain @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.uy15sDBuYNK48N3v]{Burrower}, fire gennayns gain @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.fhyQ6uTSvfErTzyE]{Jet}, metal gennayns gain @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.q9IXWngAOCpsXxsO]{Levitator}, water gennayns gain @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.A0C86V3MUECpX5jd]{Amphibious}, and wood gennayns gain @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.dWTfO5WbLkD5mw2H]{Climber}.

r @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-actions.l05WBllolnPMxMzb]{Little Wish}

@Embed[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-actions.l05WBllolnPMxMzb inline]

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-abilities.yG02eZBkhG7u2ADN]{Elemental Diplomat}

@Embed[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-abilities.yG02eZBkhG7u2ADN inline]

Grindle-Drake.name: Grindle-Drake
Grindle-Drake.description:
Access You're from the Five Kings Mountains.

Required Number of Abilities 4

Granted Abilities @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.Item.0Xrkk46IM43iI1Fv]{Darkvision}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.Item.jevzf9JbJJibpqaI]{Skilled (Perception, Survival)}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.Item.XCqYnlVbLGqEGPeX]{Touch Telepathy}

Grindlegrubs have been an essential, if unglamorous, part of the Five Kings Mountains’ food system for millennia, playing an especially important role in populous cities where enormous pits of them break down all organic waste. In these pits, the large white grubs eat voraciously, breed quickly, and provide a ready source of protein up and down the food chain. The grindlegrubs within the Five Kings Mountains were specially bred millennia ago to enhance their size and other favorable traits. This domesticated breed of grindlegrub evolved to grow to enormous sizes and eventually metamorphosize into nigh-useless large black flies too heavy to fly. Knowledge of the origins of grindlegrubs and their original forms was lost to time as the creatures’ usefulness in their modified state proved invaluable to all settlements in the region.

Centuries ago, Ylivsach Taarghan, a young scholar at the Tar-Kazmukh arcane library undertook a deep study of grindlegrubs, encouraging their metamorphosis under conditions both magical and mundane in an attempt to recreate the grindlegrubs of old. With the right combination of arcane energy and a sulfurous steam vent for incubation, Ylivsach succeeded in bringing back the scaly, foot-long creatures with bright orange and red hues as well as six legs, pointy tails, and sharp beaks. Naming these creatures grindle-drakes, Ylivsach provoked controversy with her discovery, from those who insist that these creatures aren’t related to drakes to those who insist that they aren’t metamorphosed grindlegrubs. To this day, grindle-drakes are bred in Tar-Kazmukh and sometimes gifted to friends of the Blue Warders.

2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-actions.Item.TwFgdAU71NRu9vd6]{Forage}

@Embed[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-actions.Item.TwFgdAU71NRu9vd6 inline]

2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-actions.Item.ZofYaPyIFDmsOGWv]{Sure and Steady}

@Embed[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-actions.Item.ZofYaPyIFDmsOGWv inline]

Homunculus.name: Homunculus
Homunculus.description:
Required Number of Abilities 6

Granted Abilities @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.Item.5eqcXtPsYunphMOZ]{Construct}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.Item.0Xrkk46IM43iI1Fv]{Darkvision}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.Item.cT5octWchU4gjrhP]{Manual Dexterity}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.Item.8Z1UkLEWkFWIjOF8]{Poison Reservoir}

Homunculi are tiny servitor constructs created by a crafter to serve as a spy, scout, messenger, or assistant. A homunculus is crafted using a drop of its creator's blood in addition to any other components used in crafting its body.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-abilities.Item.LdlOoUQ5fdlxINBh]{Porter}

@Embed[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-abilities.Item.LdlOoUQ5fdlxINBh inline]

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-abilities.Item.FLy8B4U3SV3P7Ryx]{Blood Link}

@Embed[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-abilities.Item.FLy8B4U3SV3P7Ryx inline]

House Drake.name: House Drake
House Drake.description:
Required Number of Abilities 6

Granted Abilities @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.0Xrkk46IM43iI1Fv]{Darkvision}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.ZHSzNt3NxkXbj1mI]{Flier}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.cT5octWchU4gjrhP]{Manual Dexterity}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.zyMRLQnFCQVpltiR]{Speech}

House drakes are loyal and friendly, but prefer to be treated as equals rather than pets.

1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-actions.eS2EFjJpQRijoDhx]{Breath Weapon (House Drake)}

@Embed[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-actions.eS2EFjJpQRijoDhx inline]

2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-actions.yEqGcBd0e0XoZ1S1]{Silver Infusion}

@Embed[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-actions.yEqGcBd0e0XoZ1S1 inline]

Tenacious Mind

Once per day, as long as your house drake took no actions on the previous round, you gain the following.

r @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-actions.9gvV9Un5XTHhhgTx]{Ferocious Will}

@Embed[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-actions.9gvV9Un5XTHhhgTx inline]

Imp.name: Imp
Imp.description:
Required Number of Abilities 7

Granted Abilities @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.0Xrkk46IM43iI1Fv]{Darkvision}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.ZHSzNt3NxkXbj1mI]{Flier}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.cT5octWchU4gjrhP]{Manual Dexterity}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-abilities.Item.pe1wQ6N70ncyN1oA]{Resistance (poison)}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.jevzf9JbJJibpqaI]{Skilled} (deception), @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.zyMRLQnFCQVpltiR]{Speech}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.XCqYnlVbLGqEGPeX]{Touch Telepathy} 

Imp familiars pretend to be subservient in order to trick their masters into losing their soul or finding an early grave.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-abilities.zRSxbDevVCHUICMR]{Imp Invisibility}

@Embed[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-abilities.zRSxbDevVCHUICMR inline]

1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-actions.R0R2q1Doj7PcMIkD]{Fiendish Temptation}

@Embed[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-actions.R0R2q1Doj7PcMIkD inline]

Kinnar.name: Kinnar
Kinnar.description:
Required Number of Abilities 6

Granted Abilities @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.Item.0Xrkk46IM43iI1Fv]{Darkvision}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.Item.2fiQzoEKu6YUnrU9]{Independent}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.Item.deC1yIM2S5szGdzT]{Lifelink}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.Item.cT5octWchU4gjrhP]{Manual Dexterity}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.Item.zyMRLQnFCQVpltiR]{Speech}

The kinnari seats herself, pressing an instrument of gourds and strings to her shoulder. The kinnara stands ready, with his tail upright, preparing for his beloved's rhythm. Kinnars are half-human, half-songbird lovers who sing, dance, and perform for and with each other, forever accompanying each other in their arts. Severance creates suffering, and neither can stay apart from the other else they both become heartbroken and die. While most kinnar pairings serving as familiars include a female kinnari and male kinnara, kinnar pairings of different genders aren't uncommon.

2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.Item.m8wjlYnTAAfddWyA]

@Embed[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.Item.m8wjlYnTAAfddWyA inline]

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-abilities.Item.3tywMMeeaiwCHyns]

@Embed[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-abilities.Item.3tywMMeeaiwCHyns inline]

2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.Item.nLrXleY20sESisoW]

@Embed[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.Item.nLrXleY20sESisoW inline]

Lantern Wisp.name: Lantern Wisp
Lantern Wisp.description:
Required Number of Abilities 6

Granted Abilities @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.Item.5eqcXtPsYunphMOZ]{Construct}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.Item.ZHSzNt3NxkXbj1mI]{Flier}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.Item.gVPtUSEPZYGRIRyQ], @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.Item.FcQQLMAJMgOLjnSv]{Resistance (fire and cold)}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.Item.Le8UWr5BU8rV3iBf]{Tough}

Lantern wisps appear as colorful, hand-made lanterns aimlessly floating around in the dark of the night, seemingly always with its flame lit in full. They house harmless, little wisps that have settled into forgotten children's playthings.

1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.Item.oOpppkBhLcfaKZN4]

@Embed[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.Item.oOpppkBhLcfaKZN4 inline]

Leshy.name: Leshy
Leshy.description: You call a minor spirit of nature into a plant body, creating a leshy companion to aid you in your spellcasting. You gain a familiar, which has your choice of either the plant or fungus familiar ability; this doesn't count against your usual limit of familiar abilities (typically 2). The spirit you call has a more tenuous connection to its plant body than fully independent leshies, so it is Tiny in size like other familiars.

Makhluk Wayang.name: Makhluk Wayang
Makhluk Wayang.description:
Required Number of Abilities 8

Granted Abilities @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.Item.5eqcXtPsYunphMOZ]{Construct}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.Item.cT5octWchU4gjrhP]{Manual Dexterity}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.Item.pX73zPGaazVJ0lKO], @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.Item.zyMRLQnFCQVpltiR]{Speech}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.Item.Le8UWr5BU8rV3iBf]{Tough}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.Item.0rq3ufpxB9iHlIkd]

Makhluk wayangs are shadow puppets, pieces of show and tell made animate, carrying no more than the personalities they were crafted to inhabit. Unlike the wayang people, your familiar is a shadowy incorporeal being without a body of its own. A mahkluk wayang possesses a simple puppet made of leather or, sometimes, from thick parchment.

1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.Item.yiIE9iWx6OLd61Qs]

@Embed[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.Item.yiIE9iWx6OLd61Qs inline]

Mockingfey.name: Mockingfey
Mockingfey.description:
Access affiliation with Cobyslarni
Required Number of Abilities 4
Granted Abilities @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.Item.ZHSzNt3NxkXbj1mI]{Flier}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.Item.2fiQzoEKu6YUnrU9]{Independent}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.Item.zyMRLQnFCQVpltiR]{Speech}

Mockingfey are tiny fey with the heads of humanoids and the bodies of colorful parrots. Though they’re mischievous and unruly, mockingfeys are very loyal to those they consider friends. They can speak and understand language, but typically communicate in pantomime instead, as they find verbal speech restrictive.

Some spellcasters ally with mockingfey as familiars, as they’re highly curious and keen—if distractable— students. Cobyslarni students and faculty, being used to the bizarre nature of the First World, are more tolerant than most of a mockingfey’s antics, and the little creatures are a common sight flitting around the school’s towers. Naturally, any pranks a mockingfey pulls on a student’s rivals are merely the unsanctioned work of an excitable familiar.

Cobyslarni representatives have found their familiars’ antics are less appreciated by the students of other schools. In part, this is because a small or feathered student doesn’t seem out of place among the Traveling Academy’s student body. Even without that confusion, many Cobyslarni students are finding they must teach their mockingfey familiars the most difficult lessons of all: when not to insult people and who to leave alone.

1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-actions.Item.yhxOhLAyefQq8g1f]{Gibe}

@Embed[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-actions.Item.yhxOhLAyefQq8g1f inline]

Mood Cloud.name: Mood Cloud
Mood Cloud.description:
Required Number of Abilities 3

Granted Abilities @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.ch6nFcRJO1fm8B4D]{Elemental} (air only), @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.ZHSzNt3NxkXbj1mI]{Flier}

This air elemental is little more than a tiny cloud with just enough internality to have emotions. Elemental scholars believe mood clouds to be related to despairing palls, though far less evolved.

1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-actions.0qcOerWoQ7WPuUTx]{Emote}

@Embed[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-actions.0qcOerWoQ7WPuUTx inline]

Nosoi.name: Nosoi
Nosoi.description:
Required Number of Abilities 5

Granted Abilities @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.0Xrkk46IM43iI1Fv]{Darkvision}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.ZHSzNt3NxkXbj1mI]{Flier}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.cT5octWchU4gjrhP]{Manual Dexterity}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.zyMRLQnFCQVpltiR]{Speech}

A nosoi's physical appearance is that of a bird—usually a crow, sparrow, or whippoorwill—though it wears a funerary mask that accentuates its beak. Nosois measure about 1 foot in length but are unusually heavy, weighing between 10 and 15 pounds.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-actions.SPol3q1Owzpx9DXV]{Haunting Melody}

@Embed[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-actions.SPol3q1Owzpx9DXV inline]

Nosoi Resistance

A nosoi has resistance to negative and poison damage equal to half your level.

Old Friend.name: Old Friend
Old Friend.description:
Required Number of Abilities 4

Granted Abilities @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.ZHSzNt3NxkXbj1mI]{Flier}

Sometimes, the spirit of a cherished pet returns from the Boneyard to continue aiding its beloved owner. These tiny animal ghosts tend to be bound to anchors such as favorite toys, collars, or carved representations of who they were in life. An old friend is less likely to be evil than other undead familiars, as is its master.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-abilities.q03CmYAD0FYepDJg]{Anchored Incorporeality}

@Embed[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-abilities.q03CmYAD0FYepDJg inline]

Undead

Your familiar is undead. It has negative healing and is immune to death effects, disease, poison, and unconscious. It's destroyed at 0 HP.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-abilities.R1H7JcGDB9cPVeFh]{Invisibility}

@Embed[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-abilities.R1H7JcGDB9cPVeFh inline]

Pipefox.name: Pipefox
Pipefox.description:
Required Number of Abilities 5

Granted Abilities @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.dWTfO5WbLkD5mw2H]{Climber}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.0Xrkk46IM43iI1Fv]{Darkvision}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.j9vOSbF9kLibhSIf]{Second Opinion}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.jevzf9JbJJibpqaI]{Skilled} (one skill of your choice), @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.zyMRLQnFCQVpltiR]{Speech}

A pipefox is a tiny magical fox with a thin, limbless body that is about a foot long. Pipefoxes are secretive, shy, evasive, and they love to acquire knowledge.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-abilities.HqZoSMpGfcXOIu1x]{Scholarly Linguist}

@Embed[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-abilities.HqZoSMpGfcXOIu1x inline]

Polong.name: Polong
Polong.description:
Required Number of Abilities 8

Granted Abilities @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.ZHSzNt3NxkXbj1mI]{Flier}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.deC1yIM2S5szGdzT]{Lifelink}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.jevzf9JbJJibpqaI]{Skilled} (society) , @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.zyMRLQnFCQVpltiR]{Speech}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.asOhEdyF8CWFbR96]{Spellcasting}

Polongs are wicked, invisible spirits created from the blood of murder victims, bound to glass bottles, and fed with the blood of their master. They're often used to possess and sicken their master's enemies. Polongs can't be found or acquired, only created, a process that can take up to two weeks. If a polong's bottle is ever destroyed, or if its master fails to provide its daily feeding of blood, the polong withers and dies.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-abilities.q03CmYAD0FYepDJg]{Anchored Incorporeality}

@Embed[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-abilities.q03CmYAD0FYepDJg inline]

2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-actions.8b3Ef7LRFdWhg1Z3]{Polong Possession}

@Embed[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-actions.8b3Ef7LRFdWhg1Z3 inline]

Undead

Your familiar is undead. It has negative healing and is immune to death effects, disease, poison, and unconscious. It's destroyed at 0 HP.

Poppet.name: Poppet
Poppet.description:
Required Number of Abilities 1 

Granted Abilities @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.Item.5eqcXtPsYunphMOZ]{Construct}

Endlessly modifiable, poppet familiars made of wicker and wood are among the most basic construct familiars available to Pathfinder agents across the globe.

Flammable

Your poppet's components make it particularly vulnerable to fire. It gains weakness to fire equal to your level. You can use one familiar ability to reinforce the poppet's construction, removing this weakness for the day.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-abilities.Item.ukOuCuUzIBScdEkD]{Not Flammable Poppet}

Psychopomp Familiar.name: Psychopomp Familiar
Psychopomp Familiar.description:
Your familiar becomes a masked psychopomp—an extraplanar guardian of the cycle of souls. This familiar continues to use all the same rules as other familiars, but one of its abilities must always be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.zyMRLQnFCQVpltiR]{Speech} and it has the monitor and psychopomp traits. As normal when a familiar must always have a certain ability, the speech ability counts against your familiar's abilities each day.

You can select three familiar or master abilities each day, instead of two, but one must be one of the following psychopomp familiar abilities.
@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.o0fxDDUu2ZSWYDTr]{Soul Sight} Your familiar gains lifesense with a range of 30 feet.
@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.nrPl3Dz7fbnmas7T]{Spirit Touch} Your familiar can touch incorporeal creatures. If you have the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.wOgvBymJOVQDSm1Q]{Spell Delivery} master ability from your familiar, any spell the familiar delivers with it gains the benefits of the ghost touch property rune.

Shadow Familiar.name: Shadow Familiar
Shadow Familiar.description:
Access you're a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.ncrNQcwm4gOQRAA3]{Shadowcaster}

Required Number of Abilities 7

Granted Abilities @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.0Xrkk46IM43iI1Fv]{Darkvision}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.cT5octWchU4gjrhP]{Manual Dexterity}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.JRP2bdkdCdj2JDrq]{Master's Form}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-abilities.Item.EYSNQeRqXvkbsy6R]{Resistance} (cold and negative), @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.j1qZiH50Bl2SJ8vT]{Shadow Step}

Some spellcasters and ritualists don't just summon and bind a familiar, but instead transform their own shadow into a familiar. These casters can be identified by their lack of a shadow regardless of the level of light in the area and by the strange muted appearance of any article of clothing or jewelry they wear. Occasionally mistaken for vampires or other undead by the cautious or superstitious, these spellcasters nonetheless find the trade worth it in exchange for the unique abilities their shadow familiar can possess.

Shadow familiars are a type of specific familiar. While all shadowcasters have access to these familiars, there are other paths to learn the proper magic to obtain a shadow familiar.

1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-actions.cIi5FoRH2iMTPiuK]{Become Shadow}

@Embed[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-actions.cIi5FoRH2iMTPiuK inline]

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-abilities.Item.PA1XPbn9Q5gpQu3d]{Slink in Shadows}

@Embed[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-abilities.Item.PA1XPbn9Q5gpQu3d inline]

1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-actions.a2TwDSrFclda143a]{Steal Shadow}

@Embed[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-actions.a2TwDSrFclda143a inline]

Shikigami.name: Shikigami
Shikigami.description:
Required Number of Abilities 6

Granted Abilities @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.Item.5eqcXtPsYunphMOZ]{Construct} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.Item.ZHSzNt3NxkXbj1mI]{Flier}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.Item.gVPtUSEPZYGRIRyQ], @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.Item.pX73zPGaazVJ0lKO], @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.Item.Le8UWr5BU8rV3iBf]{Tough}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.Item.0rq3ufpxB9iHlIkd]

Shikigami are small spirits typically summoned and bound to a paper figure, so confined to carry out the deeds and embody the will of their masters. More often than not, the naivete of these amateur practitioners of esoteric magics means they'll find themselves at the mercy of their own shikigami.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.Item.6cwswBPHm1GWdx5j]

@Embed[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.Item.6cwswBPHm1GWdx5j inline]

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.Item.1fRkeUkPJFiBJ5u6]

@Embed[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.Item.1fRkeUkPJFiBJ5u6 inline]

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.Item.2GMAPffXVayRFsLM]

@Embed[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.Item.2GMAPffXVayRFsLM inline]

Spellslime.name: Spellslime
Spellslime.description:
Required Number of Abilities 4, and you must be able to cast spells using spell slots

Granted Abilities @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.dWTfO5WbLkD5mw2H]{Climber}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.0Xrkk46IM43iI1Fv]{Darkvision}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.Le8UWr5BU8rV3iBf]{Tough}

These friendly, colorful oozes congeal from the essences left over from casting spells. They are extremely loyal.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-abilities.ZD4rTKXnn5zsa93L]{Magic Scent}

@Embed[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-abilities.ZD4rTKXnn5zsa93L inline]

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-abilities.Item.SgkRr0lXTBvs0hvP]{Ooze Defense}

@Embed[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-abilities.Item.SgkRr0lXTBvs0hvP inline]

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-abilities.PAmcjj5D9gHBxBAe]{Slime Rejuvenation}

@Embed[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-abilities.PAmcjj5D9gHBxBAe inline]

Spirit Guide.name: Spirit Guide
Spirit Guide.description:
Required Number of Abilities 3

Granted Abilities @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.2fiQzoEKu6YUnrU9]{Independent}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.deC1yIM2S5szGdzT]{Lifelink}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.zyMRLQnFCQVpltiR]{Speech}

Spirit guide familiars typically take the form of cunning guides or nimble guide.

r @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-actions.VumhWYZuqgNCsg4w]{Spiritual Recall}

@Embed[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-actions.VumhWYZuqgNCsg4w inline]

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-abilities.FzxnnXZ1ecwFhkiw]{Bound to Mortal}

@Embed[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-abilities.FzxnnXZ1ecwFhkiw inline]

Star Orb.name: Star Orb
Star Orb.description:
Your magic has crystallized into a spherical stone. You gain a familiar, except it's a star orb: a Tiny stone of light Bulk.
The familiar has no Speeds and must select a Speed familiar ability before it can move, animating in a way appropriate to the chosen Speed and using the statistics of a normal familiar for that day; when it‘s an immobile stone, it can't select any familiar or master abilities that require it to move. It always has the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.D0ltNUJnN7UjJpA1]{Innate Surge} master ability, which counts against your limit for familiar and master abilities.

Sweet Beast (Chocolate Mouse).name: Sweet Beast (Chocolate Mouse)
Sweet Beast (Chocolate Mouse).description:
Required Number of Abilities 3

Granted Abilities @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.BXssJhTJjKrfojwG]{Fast Movement}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.FlRUb8U13Crj3NaA]{Scent}

The ways of wizards are strange and mysterious, and nowhere is this more obvious than in the arcane predilection for animating random pieces of candy and using them as familiars. The Winter Witches of Irrisen are known for weaving sparrows or nightingales from gingerbread, while in Arcadia, sorcerers mold mice from spiced chocolate. Most famous, however, are the hard candy beetles of Nex, though a few radical scholars claim that they are in fact a demi-natural species, a product of the Mana Wastes' wild magic. Most mages dismiss such wild claims, however.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-abilities.Vxr31IhRdrrys2Jn]{Sorcerous Sweets}

Sweet Beast (Gingerbread Sparrow).name: Sweet Beast (Gingerbread Sparrow)
Sweet Beast (Gingerbread Sparrow).description:
Required Number of Abilities 3

Granted Abilities @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.ZHSzNt3NxkXbj1mI]{Flier}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.2fiQzoEKu6YUnrU9]{Independent}

The ways of wizards are strange and mysterious, and nowhere is this more obvious than in the arcane predilection for animating random pieces of candy and using them as familiars. The Winter Witches of Irrisen are known for weaving sparrows or nightingales from gingerbread, while in Arcadia, sorcerers mold mice from spiced chocolate. Most famous, however, are the hard candy beetles of Nex, though a few radical scholars claim that they are in fact a demi-natural species, a product of the Mana Wastes' wild magic. Most mages dismiss such wild claims, however.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-abilities.Vxr31IhRdrrys2Jn]{Sorcerous Sweets}

@Embed[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-abilities.Vxr31IhRdrrys2Jn inline]

The ways of wizards are strange and mysterious, and nowhere is this more obvious than in the arcane predilection for animating random pieces of candy and using them as familiars. The Winter Witches of Irrisen are known for weaving sparrows or nightingales from gingerbread, while in Arcadia, sorcerers mold mice from spiced chocolate. Most famous, however, are the hard candy beetles of Nex, though a few radical scholars claim that they are in fact a demi-natural species, a product of the Mana Wastes' wild magic. Talking Head.name: Talking Head
Talking Head.description:
Required Number of Abilities 3

Granted Abilities @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.rs4Awf4k1e0Mj797]{Cantrip Connection}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.jevzf9JbJJibpqaI]{Skilled} (your choice of arcana, occultism, or one kind of lore), @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.zyMRLQnFCQVpltiR]{Speech}

Similar to beheaded, these disembodied, reanimated heads (with or without skin) retain some of their arcane wisdom, making for invaluable study partners. However, they also tend to be mouthy, opinionated, or downright obnoxious with their constant chattering, leading some annoyed masters to sew their mouths shut in punishment.

Undead

Your familiar is undead. It has negative healing and is immune to death effects, disease, poison, and unconscious. It's destroyed at 0 HP.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-abilities.al90ZwxRIq3YjnWQ]{Heads Will Roll}

@Embed[Compendium.pf2e-specific-familiars.specific-familiars-abilities.al90ZwxRIq3YjnWQ inline]

Tapir Sage.description:

Granted Abilities @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.Item.0Xrkk46IM43iI1Fv]{Darkvision}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.Item.qTxH8mSOvc4PMzrP]{Kinspeech}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.Item.zyMRLQnFCQVpltiR]{Speech}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.Item.uUrsZ4WvhjKjFjnt]{Toolbearer}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.Item.9PsptrEoCC4QdM23]{Valet}

Tapir sages are intelligent creatures that desire to protect the natural world. They carry large rattan baskets on their backs.
